column5: Those ankle biters are terrible right now. Long pants are the only solution and I hate wearing pants in summer. I am going to look for some mesh pants.
Surprisingly we had our lightest year ever for bugs this year on Little Miss lake until the last night when they all came out to say hello to us. I didn't even use bug spray till that last evening.

Experienced the same "fly along" out the truck window last week. I don't believe I've ever seen this before. I think they were trying to worn us about the mosquitoes we were going to encounter! When we stopped alongside the road for a quick break, surprisingly we were not attacked. Mosquitoes were very plentiful at camp. Used coils in the cabin, and a large Roman candle type thing that we lit and stuck in the ground next to the camp fire. Along with spraying a circle around the camp fire, sitting out at night was pleasant and very little blood letting was experienced by all. Bill
Finally, in one week I will be heading up to Wabakimi Park area. For those of you just getting back how bad were the bugs?
Were bad, but I have a thermal cell and no problem. Well worth the money

Heading up to Ear Falls with lines wet in 7 days, 3 hours, but who's counting?? I would also like to hear about the nasty ankle biters. Any word from those that returned from that area? Thanks in advance
I heard two groups of 60 mosquitos debating whether they should eat me right there or drag me into the trees first.....

mosquitos were thick but tolerable with spray, the ankle biting flies drove me nuts unless there was a breeze to blow them away. The only thing i found to keep them away wass long pants and boots. The coppertone sport spray didnt work for me.
Bring bug dope and coils. Your gonna need them. The water will be very high and be careful on the road. We saw 5 moose and one dead one along the road.
The bugs were the worst I have ever seen in June! I hope it gets better for my August trip!!

The bugs are about as bad as they get this year, at least in the areas I roam. I rate mosquitoes as bad, deer flies are just coming on , but seem about normal, ankle biters seem about normal, but the true black flies (look like baby flies) are still really bad, I have the bumps to prove it, they just don't seem to want to go away this year. Bring bug dope and try wool socks for the ankle biters.

I have found that this insect repellent definitely works for those ankle biting flies. They land & leave without biting. You do have to reapply frequently. Give it a try: http://whitemountaininsectrepellent.com One week to go & heading to Lac Seul! The packing & preparing has begun! RBF

Went for a drive down a forest road on the Manitoba/Ont border this weekend. Noticed large insects doing the wingman thing on both sides of the vehicle as we rolled along. Every once in a while they would do a kamikaze and smash into the window. Curious as to the type of bug, I slowed down and was able to identify them as swarms of horseflys. Never experienced anything like it. Like a scene out of Hitchcock's "The Birds" but worse.Fought off messages of immediacy from my bladder until we were well out of the area.
